sentence: Speaker, the billionaire wins and families lose with this bill.
title: Medicaid and Social Security Cuts

sentence: Let's be clear:  When these providers and hospitals close their doors, everyone in those  communities, including, by the way, some Members of Congress and their  families, will lose their healthcare.
title: Gop Tax Scam Hurts Everyone

sentence: ``Families lose, billionaires win'' is the wrong mission for America.
title: One Big Beautiful Bill

sentence: President, I rise in strong opposition to our  colleagues' budget, the Republican budget, the Trump budget and plan  where billionaires win and families lose.
title: H. Con. Res. 14

sentence: Nationwide, nearly 100,000 American families could lose their  coverage each year if Congress fails to act.
title: Putting Americans First

sentence: Servicemembers and  their families should not lose important consumer protections simply  because they retire, separate from honorable service, or lose their  loved ones.

If these measures pass, then more pollution will fill our air, more  kids will miss school because they are sick, more seniors will land in  the hospital, more families will lose loved ones far too soon to  preventable deaths, and billions of dollars will be spent on health  expenses that could be avoided.
title: Providing Congressional Disapproval of the Rule Submitted By the Environmental Protection Agency Relating to ``California State Motor Vehicle and Engine Pollution Control Standards; Heavy-Duty Vehicle and Engine Emission Warranty and Maintenance Provisions; Advanced Clean Trucks; Zero Emission Airport Shuttle; Zero-Emission Power Train Certification; Waiver of Preemption; Notice of Decision''

sentence: Madam President, families lose, and billionaires win.
title: Establishing the Congressional Budget for the United States Government for Fiscal Year 2025 and Setting Forth the Appropriate Budgetary Levels for Fiscal Years 2026 Through 2034

sentence: This is the Republican agenda: Billionaires win; American families  lose.

sentence: In every State, hundreds of thousands of seniors, children, and  working families could lose their health insurance, thanks to  Republicans' plan to cut those hundreds and hundreds of billions of  dollars from Medicaid.

sentence: If we do nothing, millions of families will lose their healthcare.
title: Providing for Consideration of H.R. Breaking the Gridlock Act

sentence: We had that Big Beautiful Bill, as Trump calls it--or as many of us  call it, the ``Big Ugly Betrayal Bill.'' You know the one I am talking  about, the one where families lose and billionaires win that was passed  2 weeks ago.

sentence: Speaker, today I rise on behalf of Minnesota  families who will lose access to healthcare if the Republican budget  passes.

sentence: Instead, Republicans are going to raise  costs, weaken coverage, and deliberately allow the Affordable Care Act  tax credits to expire, knowing full well that millions of families will  lose affordable coverage as a result.

sentence: On  November 1, 42 million Americans including 131,000 Iowa families will  lose their food stamps.
